description:
Belle Lablac doesn’t really fit in as the only human being in a world full of anthropomorphic animals. No fangs, no fur, no scales, no claws. Lonely and eager to discover where she comes from, Belle journeys to find answers to the questions of her heart. Carrying nothing but her giant sword, the Runding, she faces a world of possibilities and pitfalls in hopes of discovering the truth.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Classical Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of classical, not to be applied to anime that use classical in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

node.description: Ubukata was exposed to a blending of cultures from early childhood until the age of fourteen, having lived in Singapore and Nepal because of his father's work. In 1996, while in college, Ubukata won the first Sneaker Taisho Gold Prize for his light novel Kuroi Kisetsu, and thus debuted as a writer. In 2003, he won the Nihon SF Taisho Award for Mardock Scramble, originally published as a three-volume series. He is involved in a wide range of projects including anime production for Fafner, video game production, and original content writing for comics such as Le Chevalier D'Eon. His other works include the Bye-Bye Earth and Spiegel novel series. In 2009, he published his first historical novel, Tenchi Meisatsu, focusing on a mathematician of the Edo period.

__Hobbies:__ drawing, playing games, dancing  

[JP Twitter](https://twitter.com/jamm3rd) | [KR Twitter](https://twitter.com/jamm2nd) 

Drew artwork for the _Magna Carta_ and the _War of Genesis_ series. He graduated from the Department of Visual Design, Faculty of Arts at Chuo University.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

__Origin:__ Perth, Australia
__Alma Mater:__ Royal College of Music (2015)

[Website](https://www.kpenkmusic.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kevinpenkin) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kevinpenkincomposer) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kpenkin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD05wgzXUYvA7rIE3XGfFFg) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/kevinpenkin) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Penkin)

An Australian anime composer and video game composer. He is best known for composing the award-winning score to the anime [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/).

Penkin grew up in Perth, Australia. His interest in game music came from listening to the "Phendrana Drifts" theme from Metroid Prime; in a 2012 interview, he referred to the theme's electronic synths and acoustic instruments as "absolute bliss." Penkin began his career with composition credits in the 2011 short films Play Lunch and The Adventures of Chipman and Biscuit Boy. In the same year, Penkin composed the soundtrack of the video game Jūzaengi: Engetsu Sangokuden; this soundtrack represented Penkin's first collaboration with [Nobuo Uematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100150). Penkin has continued to collaborate with Uematsu in titles such as Norn9 and Defender’s Quest II: Mists of Ruin.

In 2015, Penkin graduated from the Royal College of Music with a Master's degree in Composition for Screen. In 2016, Penkin collaborated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/) on the [Norn9](https://anilist.co/anime/20643/) anime and the [Under the Dog](https://anilist.co/anime/21002/) original video animation soundtracks. Penkin's relationship with Kinema Citrus continued through to 2017 for the soundtrack of [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/), winning the 2017 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it. In 2018, Penkin composed the score for the video game Florence. Penkin composed the music for Kinema Citrus' adaptation of [The Rising of the Shield Hero](https://anilist.co/anime/99263/) and NetEase's VR game Nostos in 2019. Penkin most recently composed the music for the 2020 anime adaptation of the South Korean webtoon [Tower of God](https://anilist.co/anime/115230/), winning the 2021 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it.

He used to live in the United Kingdom, but currently resides in Melbourne, Australia.

Japanese-German singer-songwriter.

Formerly known as only LMYK, Lisa Monika YK decided to share her name on [November 1st, 2024](https://www.lisamonika-yk.com/news/hellonovember) to mark a new chapter as an artist. The initials will still be LMYK, but she wants to connect more authentically by sharing her name.

Formerly known as only LMYK, Lisa Monika YK decided to share her name on [November 1st, 2024](https://www.lisamonika-yk.com/news/hellonovember) to mark a new chapter as an artist. The initials will still be LMYK, but she wants to connect more authentically by sharing her name.
5th Anisong Grand Prix Finalist with Konomi Suzuki. As Asuka Ookura, she performed Sakurasou no Pet na Kanojo ED2 "Prime Number" on February 2013.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/toruhorikoshi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/toruhorikoshi)__

__Toru Horikoshi__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and multi-instrumentalist.

**[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/flytetymejam/) | [Website (Jam & Lewis)](https://www.jamlewis.com/)**

One of the most successful writer-producers of the 1980s and on, Jimmy Jam, in tandem with partner [Terry Lewis](https://anilist.co/staff/296469), has written 41 Top 10 hits in the U.S., and also with Lewis, has more Billboard No. 1 hits than any other songwriting/production team in history. He has worked with legendary artists such as Janet and Michael Jackson, Prince, Aretha Franklin, Mariah Carey, George Michael, and many more. The duo has won 5 Grammy Awards, and in 2022 were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in the Musical Excellence category.

_(Source: Songwriters Hall of Fame; Wikipedia)_

**[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/flytetymelewis/) | [Website (Jam & Lewis)](https://www.jamlewis.com/)**

One of the most successful writer-producers of the 1980s and on, Terry Lewis, in tandem with partner [Jimmy Jam](https://anilist.co/staff/296468), has written 41 Top 10 hits in the U.S., and also with Jam, has more Billboard No. 1 hits than any other songwriting/production team in history. He has worked with legendary artists such as Janet and Michael Jackson, Prince, Aretha Franklin, Mariah Carey, George Michael, and many more. The duo has won 5 Grammy Awards, and in 2022 were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in the Musical Excellence category.

_(Source: Songwriter's Hall of Fame; Wikipedia)_
